content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>   <DDSWebService>  <GetRecord>   <record>      <head>   <id>DLESE-000-000-000-050</id>        <collection recordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-015">DLESE Community Collection (DCC)</collection>                          <xmlFormat>adn</xmlFormat>   <fileLastModified>2013-11-11T01:01:15Z</fileLastModified>          <whatsNewDate type="itemannocomplete">2006-11-10</whatsNewDate>                    <additionalMetadata realm="adn">     <accessionStatus>accessioneddiscoverable</accessionStatus>     <partOfDrc>true</partOfDrc>                                                                                        <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Challenging audience" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-A</id>        <title>Information on challenging teaching and learning situations for 'Virtual Courseware: Virtual Earthquake'</title>        <url>http://www.dlese.org/reviews/crs/index8.php</url>               </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Comment" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-C-411</id>        <title>Comment on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>I think that the students should be able to browse through the questions once again before the answers are graded. Also, the students should be allowed to go back and revisit the problems they missed.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Editor's summary" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-E</id>        <title>Editor's summary for 'Virtual Courseware: Virtual Earthquake'</title>        <url>http://www.dlese.org/reviews/crs/index10.php</url>               </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Quantitative information" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-I</id>        <title>Average scores of aggregated indices for 'Virtual Courseware: Virtual Earthquake'</title>        <url>http://www.dlese.org/reviews/crs/index7.php</url>               </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-020</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>If students are assigned to use Virtual Earthquake to learn about seismic techniques, require that they bring you their printed certificate as proof they performed the activity. Suggested for grades 8-12</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-032</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Requires fairly good computer skills.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-078</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>More explanation for the graphs and what is being presented within them.  More examples of how to complete the task being asked of the learner would also be helpful.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-090</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>This is a great website and will help you a lot.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-092</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>I like using this activity...AFTER the students have completed a paper / compass epicenter lab. They LOVE printing out their certificates at the end.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-093</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Make sure the computer lab you are using is java-enabled, especially if it "worked" at home the night before!</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-098</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>I've used single sections of the program on the overhead in my classroom to illustrate various aspects of the earthquake locating process.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-217</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Student had trouble remembering the # of minutes in a degree of latitude & longitude when graphing. I used clock time as a comparison. Students also needed guidance on saving & opening their files. They tried to open their files before they were on the site. Some students also needed help with the order in which tasks were to be done on the epicenter & magnitude section of the lab.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-220</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>This is a great site to get knowledge about earthquakes.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-221</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Make sure you get it before you start. You have know be very close befroe moving on.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-222</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>It is something fun to do and you can learn a little or a lot of different things from this website.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-223</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Follow instructions and take your time, this resource is not complicated</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-224</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Use less technical language and put in more bright colors</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-225</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>The directions could have been clearer.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-226</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>It was interesting and fun to do. Be sure to read the directions or you won't know what to do.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-227</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Don't make it so complicated.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-228</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Make the instructions more clear.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-229</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Maybe a tutorial for people less computer savvy.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-230</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Ask your teacher or classmates for help, it's confusing at the beginning, but when you get used to it, it's easy enough.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-231</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>A little more visual would make this more interesting.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-232</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Try to follow the directions as they tell you. It can get somewhat confusing.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-233</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Try and make it more fun and kid-friendly.  If it had more to keep my interest I would have gotten more than I did.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-234</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>It would be more convenient if the boxes were given different colors.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-235</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>It was very interesting and fun.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-236</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Remember that there is a key for the symbols.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-237</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>I think this was a boring resource, maybe you can make it more fun.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-238</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Use the resource key, it's there for a good reason and it works.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-239</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>The only bad thing about this resource was that it was a bit technically confusing. But otherwise, I had fun!</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-240</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>This is a fun and useful way of learning more about science.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-341</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>My daughter completed this application. It is a good learning tool (I did it with her), but suggest that you make the certificate printout in basic black and white to be easier on the inkjet printer cartridges. They have to print out the certification and turn it in. Thanks</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-351</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Practice on paper to calculate distances. It is useful to make graphs on "millimeter" graph paper.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-381</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>Run the activity simultaneously with your students so you can show them how to use some of the tools on a projector (for visual learners).</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-395</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>You need to be exact on the magnitude. For example you need to go to the .00  which makes it difficult because the lines are so close.</description>       </annotatedBy>                                      <annotatedBy collectionLabel="Community Annotated Collection"       collectionRecordId="DLESE-COLLECTION-000-000-000-005" type="Teaching tip" status="Text annotation completed">        <id>CRS-DLESE-000-000-000-050-T-416</id>        <title>Teaching Tip on 'Virtual Earthquake'</title>                <description>I would have liked to see conclusions that could be drawn from the various mathematical operations, along the lines of "... so you can see that an increase in the amount of insolation in the same amount that it was DECREASED during the last ice age will cause the temperature to increase by ..."</description>       </annotatedBy>               </additionalMetadata>                   </head>         <metadata> <itemRecord schemaLocation="http://adn.dlese.org http://www.dlese.org/Metadata/adn-item/0.6.50/record.xsd">   <general>     <title>Virtual Courseware: Earthquake</title>     <description>Virtual Earthquake is an interactive web-based program designed to introduce the concepts of how an earthquake epicenter is located and how the Richter magnitude of an earthquake is determined. Virtual Earthquake shows the recordings of an earthquake's seismic waves detected by instruments far away from the earthquake. The instrument recording the seismic waves is called a seismograph and the recording is a seismogram. The point of origin of an earthquake is called its focus and the point on the earth's surface directly above the focus is the epicenter. You are to locate the epicenter of an earthquake by making simple measurements on three seismograms that are generated by the Virtual Earthquake program. Additionally, you will be required to determine the Richter Magnitude of that quake from the same recordings. Richter Magnitude is an estimate of the amount of energy released during an earthquake.</description>     <language>en</language>     <subjects>       <subject>DLESE:Geophysics</subject>     </subjects>     <keywords>       <keyword>Earthquakes</keyword>       <keyword>Seismograph, Seismogram</keyword>       <keyword>Epicenter</keyword>       <keyword>Richter magnitude</keyword>       <keyword>S waves, P waves, S-P interval</keyword>       <keyword>Seismic waves, l</keyword>     </keywords>   </general>   <lifecycle>     <contributors>       <contributor role="Author"
